text:
hello everybody,
In hubl and html template, when you are creating custom module, then you call it with dnd_module path etc, you can precise a default value for a simple field for the page to render correctly.
I know we can precise some default value inside the custom module itself but that’s not my point.
Sometimes a button module, for example, has to be in many template and has to change its background-color according to graphic design, in this case we cannot precise inside the module a default color, I need to set my default color according to my template, so inside my main page and not inside the module.

I know we can do that :
 {% dnd_module path=‘/Catalogue 2020/Dependencies/Modules/Timeline step.module’, number_background=“primary” %}

My problem is about a button which is a repeater,  I can’t figure out the syntax I need to set a default value to the first occurence of this button. I can’t find anything on the documentation about that.

I tried a lot of things but it’s not working :
button={{0 : {cta_background=“primary”}}

if someone knows that it would be amazing ! thank youuu

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates#setting-template-level-default-values-for-repeating-fields|setting default values for repeating fields in templates>

 <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates#fp-color|The object in the array should match the color field >
